title: MinIO on Kubernetes Installation
description: A step-by-step guide to installing MinIO on Kubernetes using Helm.

steps.description: This command adds the Bitnami chart repository to your Helm configuration, allowing you to access their charts.
This command fetches the latest charts from all configured repositories.

steps.text: Create a Kubernetes namespace for MinIO.
steps.description: It's good practice to deploy applications into their own namespaces for better organization and isolation.

This command installs MinIO into the `minio` namespace. You should replace `YOUR_MINIO_ROOT_USER` and `YOUR_MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD` with strong, secure credentials for your MinIO instance. The `--generate-name` flag will create a unique release name for your MinIO deployment.
You can check the status of the deployment.
